strTitle: Trigger for the Messenger Offer Beat

[us] agrees to help out. In exchange, [them] offers thanks, good luck, and awaits [us]'s return.

strTitle: Trigger for the Messenger Agree Beat
strDesc: [us] should find a potential romantic partner for [them] and put in a good word for them.
[us] should find a potential romantic partner for [them] and put in a good word for them. They don't seem particular.

strDesc: [us] decides how to repond.
[us] says it's just romance between willing adults, and [them] shouldn't worry about citizenship or residency.
[us] assures [them] they would never ask someone to do anything illegal.
[us] assures [them] they would never ask someone to do anything illegal.
[us] confidently admits to [them] it's not likely legal, but it's the right thing to do.
[us] looks worried and insists they both should forget they ever mentioned it.
Seeking more of a payout, [us] asks [them] how much the requested task is worth to them.
strTooltip: [us] requests promise of a reward from [them] for helping. This request may cause them to back out or just feel negatively toward [us].

strDesc: [us] decides how to repond.
[us] reluctantly offers [them] $300.
[us] hesitantly offers [them] $2,000, "Take it or leave it."
After a moment, [us] offers [them] $10,000, "This is important to me."
[us] shakes their head. "I see how it is. Forget it."
Looks like [them] doesn't want [us]'s help anymore.
[us] refuses to help with [them]'s issue. Their love life is their own problem.

strTitle: Trigger for the Legal Issues Messenger Plot Start Beat
strDesc: [them] reaches out to [us], seeking help with a technical issue. They look forward to connecting when in the same area.
[us] asks [them] what help they need for their issues.
[us] explains a complex technical problem that's hindering one of their projects and asks [them] to talk to [3rd] to help them out.
[us] explains details of a dispute over responsibility for malfunctioning salvage equipment and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] explains issues resulting from software errors in some critical systems, and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help mediate the issues.
[us] describes some important digital data they can't access and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] laments supply chain disruptions that have left them limited on parts and materials needed for a project. They ask [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] seeks help finding a solution to energy allocation disputes and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] needs help determining responsibility for recent failures in safety systems. They ask [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] claims the local communications capability is degrading and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] complains of network connectivity throttling and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] seeks help with a technical hang-up in a new generation of waste management and disposal technology and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] insists that life support system are deeply in need of optimizaiton, and alteration, or replacement and asks [them] to speak with [3rd] to help them out.
[us] cannot update their Renbao PDA firmware, but the old version no longer supports critical apps. They ask [them] to enlist [3rd] to help them out.

[us]'s eager eyes dim in disbelief before they shrug and move on. "3FC? Whatever."
"Yeah Warriors!" [us] smiles sincerely and shares further mutual appreciation, assuring [them] their preference is the right one.
"Yeah Shooters!" [us] smiles confidently and shares further mutual appreciation, assuring [them] their preference is the right one.
"Yeah Rioters! Bold choice." [us] smiles conspiratorially and shares further mutual appreciation, assuring [them] their preference is the right one.
[us] wrinkles their nose and scoffs at [them]'s misguided opinion.
[us]'s eyes show doubt and momentary disappointment before they shrug and move on.

[us] wrinkles their nose and scoffs at [them]'s misguided opinion.

strTitle: Trigger for the OKLG Critter Plot Start Beat
strDesc: [us] notices an occasional rattling echoing from [them].

strTitle: Trigger for the OKLG Critter 01 Beat
strDesc: [us] looks closer at the vent.

strTitle: Trigger for the OKLG Critter 01b Beat
strDesc: [us] pounds the vent.
[us] stops and gets a better angle in the half-light. There are scratch marks and a scent of urine. Further back, there are sounds of furtive breathing.

strTitle: Fix it with a good smack
strDesc: [us] gives [them] a good smack. The rattling stops. Score one for percussive maintenance.
[us] reaches their fingers between the rusty shutter blades of [them]. Something sharp nips at them.
[us] manages to clear up some of the smell but not the scratches. Something deep inside makes a curious noise.
[us] will need to find a way to calm or earn the trust of whatever is living in the vent.
[us] slips small edible bits into the vent and backs up to wait.
Something small and gaunt shuffles from deep inside to sniff and nibble the morsel without dragging it away first.

Something small and gaunt shuffles from deep inside to sniff, nibble, and ultimately drag away the morsel. It still looks scared and may need to develop more trust. This may take a few tries, so come visit later.
[us] reaches their fingers between the rusty shutter blades of [them]. Something sharp nips at them.

[us] can get a better view now that it has developed some trust. It doesn't look like it can come out, but it doesn't retreat from friendly touch anymore.
What is it?

[us] reaches through the vent and smooths the fur of a new canine friend, scratches behind a floppy ear.
It tilts its head and croons contentedly. Its eyes convey hope [us] comes back.
strTooltip: It sure looks like a stray dog in there. Will it let you pet it?

strDesc:
[us] reaches through the vent and smooths the fur of a new feline friend, scratches under an eager chin.
It shows its belly and purrs contentedly. Its eyes convey hope [us] comes back.
strTooltip: It sure looks like a stray kitty in there. Will it let you pet it?

strDesc:
[us] reaches through the vent and smooths the fur of a new rodent friend, scratches an eager forehead between beady eyes.
It presses its body against the vent and squeaks contentedly. Its eyes convey hope [us] comes back.
strTooltip: It sure looks like a friendly rat in there. Will it let you pet it?

strDesc:
[us] reaches through the vent and scratches the warm scales of a new reptilian friend.
It closes its eyes and undulates its tail contentedly. Its eyes convey hope [us] comes back.
strTooltip: It sure looks like a bearded dragon in there. Will it let you pet it?

strDesc: Who knows how it stays alive in there. Maybe it's enhanced by Hyun Lee Petware. Regardless, [us] expects to see it here periodically.

When [us] approaches, the pup barks and pants, rolling near the grate and thudding its tail against the too-small ducts.
After roughhousing that shakes the walls, eventually it reluctantly withdraws.
Its eyes hope [us] comes back later.
strTooltip: Is the pup at the grate again? Maybe it wants to play.

strDesc:
After roughhousing that shakes the walls, eventually it reluctantly withdraws.
Its eyes shine with hope [us] comes back later.
When [us] approaches, the cat fluffs its fur and dangles its tail.
strTooltip: Is the cat at the grate again? Maybe it wants to play.

strDesc:
After nuzzles and purrs that echo through the walls, eventually it reluctantly withdraws.
Its eyes shine with hope [us] comes back later.
When [us] approaches, the omnivore rodent drops whatever it's eating to come and play.
strTooltip: Is that same rat at the grate again? Maybe it wants to play.

strDesc:
After rolling among fingers and responding to words with intelligent-sounding squeaks, it reluctantly withdraws.
Its eyes shine with hope [us] comes back later.
When [us] approaches, the patient reptile looks pleased.
strTooltip: Is that same bearded dragon at the grate again? Maybe it wants to play.

strDesc:
It makes happy noises in response to scratches and words until it eventually reluctantly withdraws.
Its eyes shine with hope [us] comes back later.
When [us] approaches, the creature's eyes are eager, but its body looks gaunt and weak. Looks like it needs some more food first.
strTooltip: It looks too hungry to play.

strDesc: [us] slips small edible bits into the vent. The critter happily helps itself, showing grateful eyes.

strTitle: Trigger for the Critter End Beat
strDesc: [us] ends the Critter plot, for now.

[us] could use some money and asks [them] for $250.

strTooltip: Give them money. What goes around comes around. Maybe next time you'll be asking them. Spacer life is hard all around.

strDesc: [us] cheerfully transfers credits to [them].
strTooltip: Give them money. Life is hard, and every person deserves dignity, let alone a bite to share, not just those with economic value.

strDesc: [us] begrudgingly transfers credits to [them], trying not to mutter too loudly about work ethic.
strTooltip: Give them money. Some people are takers, bottom-feeders siphoning off whatever others are willing to cast their way.

strDesc: [us] refuses to give [them] money.

strDesc: [us] has solicited [them] for money.

[us] notices how fit [them] is, and wishes they were as fit. Partners love a healthy body, but it's next to impossible to regularly get good enough food and exercise.
[us] notices [them]'s musculature, a rarity in micgro-g. The envy is real. Lovers like muscles.

[us] says it's a shame their mutual friend has retired.
[us] tells [them] to look up their buddy [3rd]. They're well connected and may be able to help.
[us] assures [them] they will find and talk with [3rd].
[us] asks [them] how [3rd] is supposed to help with their mutual friend's 'retirement.'

[us] is uncomfortable with how openly [them] is discussing sensitive matters. Eventually they confide that [3rd] has connections with deep pockets, few questions, and fewer qualms, and that they may be willing to play a larger role within K-Leg's power dynamics.
[us] advises them to be less obvious next time.

strTitle: Discreetly Ask How Contact Can Help
strDesc: [us] employs street slang and subtle gestures to ask (without asking) [them] how [3rd] can help with the Fixer being dead.

[us] appreciates [them]'s candor and responds with new respect. Matching the socially encrypted manner, they share that [3rd] has rich connections eager to keep the blood of the station's unofficial economy flowing, and that [3rd] seems eager to play a larger role within K-Leg's power dynamics.
[us] has solicited [them] about seeking a new fixer.
[us] mentions to [them] that [3rd] sent them here, regarding the K-Leg Fixer's demise.
[us] listens to [them], inquires about [3rd], then agrees to take up the precarious role of fence for K-Leg's underworld. They will make their way to Mescaform.
[us] gains OKLG Fixer attributes and teleports to Mescaform.
Teleport NPC to Mescaform.
[them] reaches out to [us], seeking help with an engineering research project. Ask them about it for further the details.
[us] asks [them] what help they need for their engineering research project.

[us] describes to [them] their need for collaboration with an independent scavver not subject to Ayotimiwa's oversight.
They are willing to pay good money for 20 scrap carbon fiber.
